module.name: fpWeb
module.short: Advanced web application development with actions and templates

descr.p: The fpWeb unit provides HTML-oriented functionality for web application development. It extends the basic HTTP functionality with support for web actions, template processing, and structured web modules.

This unit introduces the concept of web actions which allow mapping of URL patterns to specific handlers. It also provides template support for dynamic content generation and a complete web module framework for building complex web applications.

element.name: TFPWebAction
element.short: Web action with content and template support

descr.p: TFPWebAction extends TCustomWebAction with support for direct content assignment and template processing. This class allows actions to serve static content from string lists or process dynamic content through templates.
The action can handle requests through the OnRequest event and provides built-in content serving capabilities.

element.short: Creates a new TFPWebAction instance

descr.p: Creates a new TFPWebAction instance and initializes the internal template object. The action is added to the specified collection.

element.short: The collection that will own this action

element.name: TFPWebAction.destroy
element.short: Destroys the TFPWebAction instance

descr.p: Destroys the TFPWebAction instance and frees the associated content strings and template objects.

element.name: TFPWebAction.Assign
element.short: Assigns properties from another object

descr.p: Copies all properties from the source TFPWebAction object to this instance. This includes name, events, content, and template settings.

element.name: TFPWebAction.Assign.Source
element.short: The source object to copy properties from

element.name: TFPWebAction.Contents
element.short: Static content to serve when the action is executed

descr.p: Contains static text content that will be served when this action is executed. If the action's OnRequest event does not handle the request, this content will be returned to the client.

element.name: TFPWebAction.OnRequest
element.short: Event handler called when this action is executed

descr.p: Event that is triggered when this web action is executed. The event handler receives the request and response objects and can set the Handled parameter to True to indicate that the request has been processed.

element.name: TFPWebAction.Template
element.short: Template for dynamic content generation

descr.p: Template object used for processing dynamic content. The template can contain variable substitutions that are resolved at runtime to generate the final output.

element.name: TFPWebActions
element.short: Collection of web actions with advanced functionality

descr.p: TFPWebActions extends TCustomWebActions to provide a collection of TFPWebAction objects. It handles request routing to appropriate actions and provides content generation capabilities.
The collection maintains a reference to the currently executing action and can route requests based on URL parameters.

element.name: TFPWebActions.Add

descr.p: Creates and adds a new TFPWebAction to the collection. The newly created action is returned for further configuration.

element.name: TFPWebActions.Add.Result

element.short: The web action with the specified name

element.short: Searches for an action with the specified name

element.name: TFPWebActions.FindAction.Result

element.name: TFPWebActions.FindAction.AName

element.name: TFPWebActions.FPWebActions

descr.p: Provides indexed access to the web actions in the collection. This is the default array property for the class.

element.name: TFPWebActions.FPWebActions.Index

element.name: TFPWebActions.ActionVar
element.short: Name of the request parameter used to identify the action

descr.p: Specifies the name of the request parameter (usually a URL parameter) that contains the action name to execute. Common values include 'action', 'command', or 'page'.

element.name: TFPWebActions.CurrentAction
element.short: The currently executing web action

descr.p: References the web action that is currently being executed. This property is set during request processing and is available for the duration of the action execution.

element.name: TTemplateVar
element.short: Template variable with name and value

descr.p: TTemplateVar represents a single template variable that can be used in template processing. Each variable has a name and a corresponding value that will be substituted during template processing.

element.name: TTemplateVar.Assign
element.short: Assigns properties from another template variable

descr.p: Copies the name and value from another TTemplateVar instance to this one.

element.name: TTemplateVar.Assign.Source
element.short: The source template variable to copy from

element.name: TTemplateVar.GetDisplayName
element.short: Returns the display name for this template variable

descr.p: Returns the variable name as the display name. This is used for displaying the variable in collection editors and similar contexts.

element.name: TTemplateVar.GetDisplayName.Result
element.short: The display name (same as the variable name)

element.name: TTemplateVar.Name
element.short: The name of the template variable

descr.p: The name used to identify this variable in templates. This name is used for variable substitution during template processing.

element.name: TTemplateVar.Value
element.short: The value of the template variable

descr.p: The text value that will be substituted when the variable name is encountered in template processing.

element.name: TTemplateVars
element.short: Collection of template variables

descr.p: TTemplateVars manages a collection of TTemplateVar objects. It provides methods to find variables by name and access them by index.
This collection is used by web modules to maintain template variables that can be referenced during template processing.

element.short: Returns the index of the variable with the specified name

descr.p: Searches for a template variable with the given name and returns its index in the collection. Returns -1 if no variable with the specified name is found.

element.name: TTemplateVars.IndexOfVar.Result
element.short: The index of the variable, or -1 if not found

element.name: TTemplateVars.IndexOfVar.AName
element.short: The name of the variable to search for

element.name: TTemplateVars.VarByName
element.short: Returns the variable with the specified name

descr.p: Finds and returns the template variable with the given name. Raises an exception if no variable with the specified name is found.

errors.p: Raises EFPWebError if the variable name is not found.

element.name: TTemplateVars.VarByName.Result
element.short: The template variable with the specified name

element.name: TTemplateVars.VarByName.AName
element.short: The name of the variable to find

element.name: TTemplateVars.FindVar
element.short: Searches for a variable with the specified name

descr.p: Searches for a template variable with the given name. Returns nil if no variable with the specified name is found.

element.name: TTemplateVars.FindVar.Result
element.short: The template variable with the specified name, or nil if not found

element.name: TTemplateVars.FindVar.AName
element.short: The name of the variable to search for

element.name: TTemplateVars.Variables
element.short: Array property providing indexed access to template variables

descr.p: Provides indexed access to the template variables in the collection. This is the default array property for the class.

element.name: TTemplateVars.Variables.I
element.short: The index of the template variable to access

element.name: TContentEvent
element.short: Event type for content generation

descr.p: Event type used for content generation callbacks. The event passes a content stream that can be written to.

element.name: TContentEvent.Sender
element.short: The object that triggered the event

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule
element.short: Base class for web modules with action and template support

descr.p: TCustomFPWebModule extends TSessionHTTPModule with support for web actions, template processing, and advanced request handling. This class provides the foundation for building complex web applications with structured request routing and dynamic content generation.
The module manages a collection of web actions, template variables, and provides hooks for request preprocessing and response postprocessing.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.CreateNew
element.short: Creates a new web module instance

descr.p: Creates a new web module and initializes the actions collection, template, and template variables. This constructor is used instead of the standard Create constructor to support the component creation mode.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.CreateNew.AOwner
element.short: The component that will own this web module

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.CreateNew.CreateMode
element.short: The creation mode for the component

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.Destroy
element.short: Destroys the web module instance

descr.p: Destroys the web module and frees all associated resources including template variables, template, and actions collection.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.HandleRequest
element.short: Processes an incoming HTTP request

descr.p: Main request handling method that processes incoming HTTP requests. This method coordinates session management, action execution, template processing, and response generation.
The method calls various hooks in sequence: BeforeRequest, OnRequest, action processing, template processing, and AfterResponse.

errors.p: May raise EFPWebError if the request cannot be handled.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.HandleRequest.ARequest
element.short: The HTTP request to process

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.HandleRequest.AResponse
element.short: The HTTP response to generate

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.Actions
element.short: Collection of web actions for this module

descr.p: Contains the collection of web actions that can be executed by this web module. Actions are selected based on request parameters and executed to handle specific requests.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.ActionVar
element.short: Name of the request parameter used to identify actions

descr.p: Specifies the name of the request parameter that contains the action name to execute. This is typically a URL parameter like 'action' or 'command'.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.BeforeRequest
element.short: Event called before request processing

descr.p: Event triggered before the main request processing begins. This can be used for request preprocessing, authentication, or logging.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.OnRequest
element.short: Event called for request processing

descr.p: Event triggered during request processing. If this event handles the request and sets the Handled parameter to True, no further processing occurs.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.AfterResponse
element.short: Event called after response processing

descr.p: Event triggered after the response has been generated and sent. This can be used for cleanup, logging, or response postprocessing.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.OnGetAction
element.short: Event called to determine which action to execute

descr.p: Event that allows custom logic for determining which action should be executed for a given request. This provides more flexibility than the standard action variable lookup.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.DefActionWhenUnknown
element.short: Whether to use the default action when no specific action is found

descr.p: Determines whether the default action should be executed when no action name is specified in the request or when the specified action cannot be found.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.ModuleTemplate
element.short: Template used for content generation

descr.p: Template object used for dynamic content generation when no action handles the request. The template can contain variables that are substituted during processing.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.OnGetParam
element.short: Event called to resolve template parameters

descr.p: Event triggered when a template parameter needs to be resolved during template processing. This allows dynamic parameter value generation.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.OnTemplateContent
element.short: Event called for template content processing

descr.p: Event triggered for template content processing. This is an alias for the OnGetParam event and provides the same functionality.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.Request
element.short: The current HTTP request being processed

descr.p: Provides access to the HTTP request currently being processed. This property is only valid during request processing and is set to nil when no request is active.

element.name: TCustomFPWebModule.Response
element.short: The current HTTP response being generated

descr.p: Provides access to the HTTP response currently being generated. This property is only valid during request processing and is set to nil when no request is active.

element.name: TFPWebModule
element.short: Complete web module with published properties

descr.p: TFPWebModule is the complete implementation of a web module that publishes all properties from TCustomFPWebModule. This class is intended for use in visual design environments and provides access to all web module functionality through published properties.

element.name: TFPWebModule.BeforeRequest

descr.p: Published version of TCustomFPWebModule.BeforeRequest.

element.name: TFPWebModule.OnRequest

descr.p: Published version of TCustomFPWebModule.OnRequest.

element.name: TFPWebModule.OnGetAction
element.short: Event called to determine which action to execute

element.name: TFPWebModule.DefActionWhenUnknown

descr.p: Determines whether sessions should be automatically created for incoming requests. This property is inherited from the parent HTTP module class.

element.short: The current session object

element.name: TFPWebModule.Kind
element.short: The module kind

descr.p: Specifies the kind of web module. This property is inherited from the parent HTTP module class.

element.name: TFPWebModule.OnNewSession
element.short: Event called when a new session is created

element.name: TFPWebModule.OnSessionExpired
element.short: Event called when a session expires

descr.p: Event triggered when a session expires or is explicitly terminated. This property is inherited from the parent HTTP module class.

element.name: TFPWebModule.AfterInitModule
element.short: Event called after module initialization

descr.p: Event triggered after the module has been initialized. This property is inherited from the parent HTTP module class.

element.name: TFPWebModule.CORS
element.short: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing configuration

descr.p: Configuration object for Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) support. This property is inherited from the parent HTTP module class.

element.name: EFPWebError
element.short: Exception class for web-related errors

descr.p: EFPWebError is the exception class used throughout the fpweb unit for web-related errors. It extends EHTTP to provide specific error handling for web application functionality.

element.name: SErrInvalidVar
element.short: Error message for invalid template variable names

descr.p: Resource string used when an invalid template variable name is encountered.

element.name: SErrInvalidWebAction
element.short: Error message for invalid web actions

descr.p: Resource string used when an invalid web action is encountered during request processing.

element.name: SErrNoContentProduced
element.short: Error message when no content is produced

descr.p: Resource string used when no content is produced during template or action processing.
